poem:
### The Silence Between

In the heart of the world,  
a whisper dances, frail,  
between the clash of forces.  
Words, like broken glass,  
crunch underfoot.  

The distance of intent  
bridges nothing; arms still  
cradle silence. Hope  
observes from a distance,  
wearing a crown of what-ifs,  
an Easter pause, a wound  
half-healed,  
waiting on the absence of war.
